title: Dissipative Phase Transition in the Two-Photon Dicke Model
authors: Aanal Jayesh Shah, Peter Kirton, Simone Felicetti, and Hadiseh Alaeian
abstract:
We explore the dissipative phase transition of the two-photon Dicke model, a
topic that has garnered significant attention recently. Our analysis reveals
that while single-photon loss does not stabilize the intrinsic instability in
the model, the inclusion of two-photon loss restores stability, leading to the
emergence of superradiant states which coexist with the normal vacuum states.
Using a second-order cumulant expansion for the photons, we derive an
analytical description of the system in the thermodynamic limit which agrees
well with the exact calculation results. Additionally, we present the Wigner
function for the system, shedding light on the breaking of the Z4-symmetry
inherent in the model. These findings offer valuable insights into
stabilization mechanisms in open quantum systems and pave the way for exploring
complex nonlinear dynamics in two-photon Dicke models.
